file_content.text: My superiors are sending in another battalion to crush this Jawa rebellion for good.
Ah, I'm glad you came back. When my men brought me that shaman... it looks like she put up quite a fight.
No tribal witch doctor can stand up to a Sith.
It was easy.
Even with the Force abilities our scientists are finding, it's clear they're no match for trained Sith.
Our scientists found no evidence that shaman has any Force sensitivity at all.
I think you can say those Jawas learned their lesson.
I wasn't pulling punches.
Our scientists tell me the shaman does indeed use the Force.
Those Jawas will think twice about opposing the Empire again.
I tried to make an impression.
Now that we know they use the Force, we can bring in Sith to overwhelm them.
Now that we know their so-called shamans have no true Force powers, we can crush their pathetic rebellion.
I'd like more than "thanks."
What have your scientists learned?
Any results?
Every test shows this Jawa does have some connection to the Force.
It's too soon to tell the extent of this ability in the population, but the Empire won't underestimate them.
I'll be certain my superiors know who made this possible.
The Sith will be relieved. It seems the Force is too complex for such a simple species to master.
Thanks to you, we can proceed with our colonization of Tatooine without delay.
Lord Berow should be expecting you.
We must stop them. This shaman, the one training their armies, we need to bring her into custody, study her. Learn what she is made of....
Do your scientists prefer their specimens alive or dead?
I will hunt her down.
Let's talk price.
I'm certain I can arrange for a small payment to be shared among you. Force user or not, one Jawa can scarcely hope to defeat such a group.
Your going rate for Force users will be fine.
I assure you, you will not go unrewarded for your aid.
Please take her alive--the Sith must observe her using the Force, there is little her corpse can tell them.
It's ridiculous to think these creatures could fight the Empire.
The Jawas are no threat.
Not our decision. General Kawrelak's Sith advisor has seen my report and wishes to study this shaman firsthand.
I hope I can rely on you to make this happen.
I'll hunt down this so-called "Shaman."
Of course.
Your enthusiasm is admirable, but I wouldn't suggest capturing a Force user without a means to restrain her.
This colony was recently favored by a visit from a Sith Lord, Lord Berow. She's known for having captured Jedi. Seek her aid.
Dragging back an unwilling Force user is easier said than done.
What are you proposing?
I'll try.
We are fortunate to have a Sith Lord in this very colony. Lord Berow.
Speak with her. She made her reputation taking Jedi alive. She may have... techniques to share.
I'll tell her to expect you.
Ah, I must thank you for the work you did with the Jawa communications.
The bugs you set are already transmitting. Any rebellion the Jawas plan will come straight to our ears.
I trust finding the cipher gave you little difficulty?
Let's see if this confirms your theories.
I have it right here.
It was simple.
The Jawas truly pose a greater threat than they seem.
I ran into some trouble.
Let me transmit the code to our surveillance team....
Ah! Yes! The Jawas speak of "spirit wielders," those who possess the magic of their "shamans." I assume they mean the Force.
Their young go to a secret training ground to learn the shamans' magic. They are building an army there.
Do not forget the cipher. Without it, their communications are worthless.
My lord. Your reputation for ruthless perfection precedes you.
Was that rather bald-faced flattery a preface to asking my assistance?
You wish a favor, perhaps?
Are you certain you're addressing the proper Sith?
What about my reputation?
I'm glad the propaganda reached you all the way out here.
Word travels quickly.
My lord. Even here on Tatooine we have heard of your meteoric rise in the ranks of the Sith.
Don't worry. No one on Korriban could believe it either.
We were all shocked.
Do you really want the Sith to know you've been gossiping about them?
Remember your place!
Sounds like someone's been keeping tabs on you.
A long way for news to travel.
Yes. Yes. You get your Sith suck-up points. Now was this about anything?
Skip the flattery.
Welcome to Tatooine. I believe I am one of the few here privileged to have the true knowledge of your position and identity.
Shall I silence him for the security of the Empire?
Is he a threat?
If you're looking for money, my associate has more convincing ways to keep our secrets.
Is that a blackmail attempt?
My lord, I meant no insult--only to preface my request that you use your special knowledge to assist the Empire.
Are you trying to tell me you're a threat?
Not a wise thing to admit.
No one needs the bounty hunter when there are "Imperial officials" around....
Fine. Ignore me.
Welcome to Tatooine. I understand you have been a far better servant of the Empire than your appearance would lead one to believe.
Ah, "servant of the Empire." I love hearing you called that.
A perfect description.
I don't recall the Empire treating its servants particularly well.
Is that a compliment?
We are all no more than servants to the Empire, and I hope we may assist each other.
I'm pretty sure there was an insult in there somewhere.
Did he just call you ugly?
I meant no insult. It's my hope that you all might take a moment to assist me. For the sake of our Empire.
My relationship with the Empire is strictly business.
I "serve" no one.
Then perhaps you will be interested in this opportunity.
Identify yourself.
My name is Commander Vilos. I came to Tatooine to eliminate the Jawa problem.
Do not presume you know me.
I did not mean to be overly familiar. I only wanted to ask a question.
I was wondering, in all of your travels, have you had much experience with Force use among... lesser alien species?
There is little I do not know about the Force.
What do you want to know?
I ask specifically about Jawas--the natives here. I was told to expect no trouble.
I'm not exactly an expert in the Force.
What do you want to know?
Have you ever fought the Jawas? Natives here--I was told they would give us no trouble.
What do you mean by "lesser" aliens?
Was that an insult?
No offense intended. I was referring to the natives here, the Jawas. I was told they would give us no trouble.
Spit it out.
The Jawas. You've seen them. Little, unimpressive, unimportant sand-rats.
Is it possible they use the Force? A dozen of my officers were killed by the vermin, all with burns, from lightning.
If the Jawas are using the Force to resist our occupation, we must bring proof to the Dark Council, so that they may crush the threat.
What would it take to convince them?
What sort of proof?
I have some information from the one patrol that managed to return.
That's ridiculous. No squeaking scavenger can master the Force.
Jawas don't use the Force!
That's why I need proof. No Sith will believe it otherwise. But listen to what we've just discovered.
The Jawa tribes are not as isolated as we thought. Apparently they communicate with each other using secret relays in the deep desert.
If they're training Force users, those relays will be our way to find out where and how.
What are you thinking? Bug the relays?
Can I help?
Exactly, but it's harder than it sounds. They're paranoid wretches--reconstituted assault droids around every relay, and the messages go in coded bursts.
Are you just running your mouth, or were you going to ask me to do something?
Is this a job offer?
I'll offer a solid bounty if you'll bug the relays for me. But be careful, they've got reconstituted assault droids around every one and the messages are in code.
Let's hear the plan.
We need to bug the relays. But the Jawas have reconstituted assault droids around every one, and the messages are in code.
The communications relays are in the desert outside Mos Ila. If you want to help, plant these bugs on them, then hunt down the ranking Jawas in the area.
If we're lucky, one of them has the cipher for the code.
I'm not chasing down some Force-using boogeyman for you.
This is stupid. [Refuse quest]
Keep trying. [Refuse quest]
Yes, my lord.
As you wish.
I've fought plenty of Force users, I'll tell you that.
What aliens?
These Jawas are proving more resistant than expected.
